summary: "Cinderella" is a well-known folk tale about a young girl who goes from a bad situation to great luck, often becoming a princess. It has many versions worldwide, with the oldest known story told by the Greek geographer Strabo over 2,000 years ago. The popular version in English was written by Charles Perrault in 1697. The name Cinderella means someone who is not recognized at first but later becomes successful. Today, "Cinderella" still influences movies, books, and even sports, where an unexpected winner is called a "Cinderella."
title: Cinderella
